recipes.title: Bacon Pistachio Crusted Scallops

winePairing.pairingText: Fish works really well with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Holm Oak Tasmania Pinot Gris with a 4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 21 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Holm Oak Tasmania Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: This wine has beautiful lifted pear and jasmine characters on the nose with some hints of creamy, leesy characters underneath. Whilst the powerful palate is packed with flavor, it also has added complexity and weight as a result of the wild barrel ferment. The wine finishes with lovely crisp natural acidity.

recipes.instructions: Combine the bacon, pistachios, green onions and rosemary in a small food processor (or blender).Blend for 10-15 seconds, or until well combined.Place the mixture on a plate or in a shallow bowl.Sprinkle both sides of each scallop with salt and pepper.Coat each side of the scallop with the bacon pistachio mixture.Place the skillet with bacon grease back on the stove top over medium heat and add the scallops.Cook for 3-4 minutes per side.
